elements.title: Hermanus Johannes Lovink (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Dutch agriculturist Hermanus Johannes Lovink (pictured) used a suitcase gramophone during his lectures?

elements.title: a student newspaper (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Vancouver School Board's alleged attempt to censor a student newspaper led to the drafting of a press-freedom act?

elements.title: one of SZA's singles (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that fans on TikTok were behind the choice of name for one of SZA's singles?

elements.title: Texas Centennial half dollar (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that when sales slowed on the Texas Centennial half dollar, Senator Tom Connally suggested minting five separate versions?

elements.title: fourteen players selected to a national All-Pro team (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Green Bay Packers once had fourteen players selected to a national All-Pro team?

elements.title: Crown Building (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Philippine dictator Ferdinand Marcos bought New York City's Crown Building because of a tearful plea?

elements.title: Dan Erlewine (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the magazine Acoustic Guitar said that Dan Erlewine "might be the most famous guitar repairperson on earth"?

elements.title: Nihilism (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that models in the runway show for Nihilism by Alexander McQueen were dressed in plastic, locusts, rust, and clay?

elements.title: Band of Angels (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that literary critic Leslie Fiedler called the novel Band of Angels "operatic in the worst sense of the word"?
